Detailed Description

One or two dimensional collection of profile histograms.

Definition at line 19 of file ProfileCollection_t.hh.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::ProfileCollection_t ( const std::string &  collection_name,
const EVENT::StringVec &  name_list,
UInt_t  n_hist,
const HistPar &  par 
) throw (std::bad_alloc, std::runtime_error) [inline]

Create a collection of profile histograms which will have the same binning of the x-axis.

Parameters:
collection_name the of the histogram collection
name_list a vector which contains a name for each profile histogram of the collection.
n_hist the number of histograms to be created
par the binning of the histograms

If the name_list is empty the name of the collection is used. The name will be extended by the index in the collection.

The profile histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

Definition at line 36 of file ProfileCollection_t.hh.

References createProfiles().

histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::ProfileCollection_t ( const std::string &  collection_name,
const EVENT::StringVec &  name_list,
const lcio::IntVec &  n_hist_list,
const HistPar &  par 
) [inline]

Create a collection of profile histograms which will have the same binning of the x-axis.

Parameters:
collection_name the of the histogram collection
name_list a vector containing the names of the profile histograms whose length is either equals n_hist or is zero. In the latter case the collection name is used for the all profile histograms.
n_hist_list the number of profile histograms to be created
par the binning of the histogram
Returns:
pointer to the histogram collection

The profile histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).

Definition at line 60 of file ProfileCollection_t.hh.

References createProfiles().

histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::ProfileCollection_t ( lcio::LCCollection *  profile_histograms,
lcio::IntVec *  indices 
) [inline]
Parameters:
profile_histograms the linearised one or two dimensional collection of profile histograms
indices optional list of indicies used to give two dimensional access to the profile histogram list. for each possible index of the first dimension is needed which contains the offset in the list. The second index is added to this offset.

Definition at line 76 of file ProfileCollection_t.hh.

References _majorIndex.

histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::ProfileCollection_t ( lcio::LCCollection *  profile_histograms  )  [inline]

Create a profile histogram collection from lcio collection.

Parameters:
profile_histograms the linearised one or two dimensional collection of profile histograms (two dimensional collections have the collection parameter "major"). The method does not verify whether the lcio collection really is a histogram collection. However, if the collection has the parameter "major" it creates an index vector (costly operation) assuming that it is a 2d array instead of a 1d array(i.e. collection). The unique group id remains undedfined since it is not stored in the lcio collection.

Definition at line 98 of file ProfileCollection_t.hh.

References _majorIndex.

Member Function Documentation

const lcio::LCCollection* histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::collection (  )  const [inline]

get the collection of histograms (read only).

The index array needed for the two dimensional acces is added as a parameter named "major".

void histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::copyNames (  )  const [inline, private]

Copy the names from the collection to an accessible vector.

lcio::LCCollection * histmgr::ProfileCollection_t::createProfiles ( const std::string &  collection_name,
const EVENT::StringVec &  name_list,
const lcio::IntVec &  n_hist_list,
const HistPar &  par 
) throw (std::bad_alloc,std::runtime_error)

create several histograms which will have the same binning and the same name (except of a numeric extension).

Parameters:
collection_name the of the histogram collection
name_list a vector containing the names of the histograms whose length is either equals n_hist or is zero. In the latter case the collection name is used for the all histograms.
n_hist_list the number of histograms to be created
par the binning of the histogram
Returns:
pointer to the histogram collection

The histograms are only written to a file if the histogram group, to which this histogram belongs, is assigned to a file (histmgr::HistMgr::assignFileName).
